# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code for your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str, ' ')
    result = ""
    line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            result *= "\n" * line
            line = "$word "
        else
            line *= "$word "
        end
    end
    
    return result * "\n" * line
end
```

Here is an example of how to use the function:

```julia
str = "This is a test string. It will be wrapped if necessary."
println(wrap_string(str, 15))
```

In this case, it wraps after every 15 characters, so you'll see a new line after each word in the example output. You can change `text_width` to adjust how many characters are allowed on each line.
